Name: Maximum working hours for home care aides.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to maximum working hours for home care aides
BodyName: Committee on Civil Service and Labor

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor

Summary: This bill would set the maximum working hours that an employer may assign to a home care aide. The hours would be limited to 12 hours for any one shift, or within any 24 hours period, and 50 hours within a week. A home care aide could be assigned additional hours in the event of an emergency.

\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sa160\sl480\slmult1\qj\'a7 3. Chapter 12 of title 20 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new subchapter 8 to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\sa160\sl480\slmult1\qc\ul SUBCHAPTER 8\par
MAXIMUM HOURS FOR HOME CARE AIDES\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\'a7 20-1281 Definitions. As used in this subchapter, the following terms have the following meanings:\par
Home care aide\cf1 . The term \ldblquote home care aide\rdblquote  means a home health aide, personal care aide, personal care attendant, consumer directed personal assistant, home attendant or other licensed or unlicensed person whose primary responsibility includes the provision of in-home assistance with activities of daily living, instrumental activities of daily living or health-related tasks, or the provision of companionship or fellowship, excluding any person who provides any such service to a family member.\par
\cf0 Unforeseeable emergent circumstance. The term \ldblquote unforeseeable emergent circumstance\rdblquote  means an unpredictable or unavoidable occurrence that requires immediate action.\par
Shift. The term \ldblquote shift\rdblquote  means any period of time during which a home care aide (i) is the sole home care aide at the place of employment who is able to provide the services for which the home care aide is engaged, (ii) is required to be available to provide such services, or (iii) is not permitted to leave the place of employment.\par
\'a7 20-1282 Maximum home care hours. a. No employer shall assign any home care aide to work:\par
1. Any one single shift exceeding 12 hours; \par
2. Consecutive 12-hours shifts; \par
3. Shifts totaling more than 12 hours in any 24-hour period; or\par
4. Hours in excess of 50 per week.\par
b. In the event of an unforeseeable emergent circumstance, an employer may assign a home care aide hours in excess of the maximum hours set forth in subdivision a, provided that the employer has exhausted all reasonable efforts to obtain proper staffing. Such excess hours shall not exceed two hours per day or 10 hours per week. A staffing shortage shall not constitute an unforeseeable emergent circumstance. \par
c. Any requirement of a home care aide to accept an assignment for hours in excess of the maximum hours set forth in subdivision a contained in any contract, agreement or understanding executed or renewed after the effective date of this local law that added this section shall be void.\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone\'a7 4. This local law takes effect 90 days after it becomes law.\par
